function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Potential bias in the classification of urban-rural levels based on outdated scheme","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exclusion of confounding factors with vif \\\\u2265 4 may lead to incomplete understanding of the impact of green space factors on infection rates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Proximity to forest increasing infection rate","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Local park area as a potential transmission hotspot","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Population-weighted forest exposure and infection rates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete infection data at the county level","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The study focuses on the relationship between green spaces and sars-cov-2 infection rates, which may oversimplify the complex factors contributing to disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The study assesses the impact of green spaces on sars-cov-2 infection rates, but other environmental factors and behaviors may also contribute to disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The study explores the relationship between green spaces and sars-cov-2 infection rates, but lacks consideration of disparities in access to green spaces and healthcare resources.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unknown relationship between green spaces and sars-cov-2 infection rates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconclusive findings from existing studies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Short study periods and exclusion of confounding factors","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for green spaces as a mitigating factor for sars-cov-2 infection","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited data on the relationship between green spaces and infection rates across multiple waves of the pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertainty about the characteristics and optimal buffer distance of green space exposure for reducing sars-cov-2 infection rates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to implement frequent handwashing and barrier measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of structured programme for instruction and education on public health measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate isolation of people with suspected respiratory tract infections","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of compliance with low-cost interventions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective evaluation of global and resource-intensive measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited capability for long-term maintenance of strict hygiene and barrier routines","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Varying measurement units and missing standard deviations may lead to inaccurate data analysis and conclusions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited evidence for the effectiveness of barrier devices like n95 masks over simple surgical masks.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Confounding additional routines may affect the interpretation of the effectiveness of interventions such as adding virucidals or antiseptics to normal handwashing.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High transmission of respiratory viruses among younger children","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential for confounding in studies evaluating reduced transmission of respiratory viruses","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High transmission of sars epidemic in china, singapore, and vietnam in 2003","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate blinding or adjustment for confounders in study design","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inappropriate interventions and comparison causing problems with study designs","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Compliance issues with interventions, especially educational programmes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete or no reporting of key data randomisation, blinding, numerators and denominators, interventions, outcomes, attrition of participants, confidence intervals, cluster coefficients .","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Confusion between cohort design and before-and-after design, leading to unsupported conclusions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential biases such as cash incentives given to participants.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate randomisation in randomised studies leading to biased results.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of potential confounders in non-randomised studies affecting the accuracy of results.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistent data extraction and aggregation leading to unreliable pooled estimates.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exclusion of vaccines and antivirals from the study","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"No language restrictions applied to study search","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of outdated search databases up to november 2006","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High incidence rates of respiratory viruses during major epidemics worldwide","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Serious pandemic viral infections such as sars and avian influenza","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of single measures such as vaccines or antivirals in interrupting the spread of influenza","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Privacy concerns and surveillance societies related to big data analytics","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inability of urban big data to capture underlying cause-effect relationships","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Need for understanding human behavior at individual and collective levels","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of clear and targeted messaging in different regions","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on complex multidimensional mobility index data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid development of data resource without comprehensive planning","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Open collaboration between research institutions and public authorities may lead to unfiltered or unverified data being used in decision-making processes.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of division of agreed goals between research institutions and public authorities may lead to conflicting priorities and objectives in the development of public monitoring programmes","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
